author: gstein
msg: Followup to r40188: scan_addition() gives us all we need in a single
iteration, so remove the looping. Also, read_info() might NOT give us what
we need, so we'll have to scan for it.
(svn_wc__node_get_repos_info): remove the looping, add some comments,
and make the info-fetching more robust

author: pburba
msg: (svn_client_merge3): Tweak doc string for RECORD_ONLY argument.
(merge_props_changed): Only allow svn:mergeinfo prop changes to be changed.
Exit early if this is a --record-only merge.
(do_directory_merge): Actually drive the editor for --record-only merges.

author: gstein
msg: Be a little smarter about finding the root of trunk. This script may not
(): look for the '/subversion' or '/tools' directories to determine
where the root is located. these aren't precise path tests, but
they're quite fine for this script

author: pburba
msg: (svn_wc__node_get_repos_info): Add SCAN_ADDED arugment allowing ability to
find the *intended* root URL and/or UUID of added nodes.
Remove local svn_wc_entry_t *'s and use interim svn_wc__node_* APIs
Update calls to svn_wc__node_get_repos_info(), passing SCAN_ADDED=false in

author: bhuvan
msg: New script to generate the junit reports for Subversion test cases. The
junit reports can be used by continuous integration tools like Hudson
The junit reports are generated by parsing the tests log file,
tests.log. The test results, PASS, FAIL and SKIP are marked as
appropriate in the junit reports. The XFAIL tests are considered as
PASS. This script can take options: --log-file and --output-dir.
The value for --log-file option denotes the log file to parse for
The value for --output-dir option denotes the directory to store the
junit reports. A separate file is created in this directory for each
